meanings.definition: A three-pronged spear used for fishing or hunting.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman caught a big fish with his tridents.
meanings.sent2: The tridents were essential tools for the hunters in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The tridents decided to go on strike because they were tired of catching fish.
meanings.sent4: Her tridents of knowledge helped her navigate through the difficult exam questions.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tridents gleamed under the sunlight as they were cast into the river.

meanings.definition: A three-pronged spear used as a symbol of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The king held his tridents high to show his authority.
meanings.sent2: The tridents on the royal coat of arms represented strength and control.
meanings.sent3: The tridents at the meeting table were a reminder of who was in charge.
meanings.sent4: Her tridents of leadership guided the team to success.
meanings.sent5: The tridents of the sea god were said to bring calm to the stormy waters.
